text: ahhh same! yeah it's generally quite small, we look for technical skills as much as artistry, having a good solid reel (and stating what they've done on it always helps us to narrow down candidates) knowledge of the software that we use is attractive, but or similar software is fine too - there isn't much time for in-house training but we'll guide them through the pipeline and try to have a little documentation, give them some practise/easier shots to start with, and fixes to help get used to the setups. So far people seem to slot in quite well, and the studio cater really well for peoples ambitions too, if you have eyes on another department, for example! How is it going with your projects? Do you have much to wrap up before the christmas break?
